comments:
This bug doesn't seem to prevent anyything from working as expected but far too
many modal windows appear with the brief message "An error has occurred.  See
error log for more details".  Further below I have pasted a fresh Eclipse log
with the relevant stack traces.

This is what I did:

1) Fresh installation of 3.1M4 and all necessary components (I expand below)
2) Worked my way through the tutorial "Building a School Schedule Web
Application) by Lawrence Mandel
3) Have closed/opened project and exit/started eclipse several times

From what I can remember, the modal windows did not appear in the beginning but
at some point they started appearing repeatedly.  I am happy to provide further
details if you need them.

Now the details:

<<INSTALLATION>>

My installation is completely fresh and rather than using Software Updates /
Find and Install, I have done the following:

1- install Eclipse from eclipse-SDK-3.1M4-win32.zip
by just extracting the archive to your selected directory

2- install these 3 packages:
emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-I200412160800.zip
GEF-SDK-I20041216.zip
JEM-runtime-1.0.2.zip

again by just extracting them to the same directotry. Take care that the 
plugin & features directories in the archives are extracted/match to the 
same place in your eclipse installation.

3- install the XML libs, as deescribed here: 
http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/wst/components/xml/xercesInfo.xml


4- Start your eclipse like this:

eclipse -clean

This bug was fixed several months ago and the failing method doesn't even 
exist. Please upgrade to a more recent WTP.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.

Marking as verified as I know this issue is fixed (or correctly categorized).
If, as originator, you disagree or still see, please re-open, or open a new bug. 

Thanks very much for reporting and helping make WTP better.
